sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using Cramer's rule
message_1:
Solve the system of linear equations below using Cramer's rule:

3x + 2y + z = 14

4x - y + 3z = -1

2x + 5y - 2z = 9
message_2:
To solve the given system of linear equations using Cramer's rule, we first need to find the determinant of the coefficient matrix, which we'll call D.

The coefficient matrix is:
| 3  2  1 |
| 4 -1  3 |
| 2  5 -2 |

D = 3((-1)(-2) - (3)(5)) - 2((4)(-2) - (3)(2)) + 1((4)(5) - (-1)(2))
D = 3(2 - 15) - 2(8 - 6) + 1(20 + 2)
D = 3(-13) - 2(2) + 1(22)
D = -39 - 4 + 22
D = -21

Now we need to find the determinants of the matrices with the columns replaced by the constants from the right-hand side of the equations. We'll call these determinants Dx, Dy, and Dz.

For Dx, replace the first column with the constants (14, -1, 9):
| 14  2  1 |
| -1 -1  3 |
|  9  5 -2 |

Dx = 14((-1)(-2) - (3)(5)) - 2((-1)(-2) - (3)(9)) + 1((-1)(5) - (-1)(9))
Dx = 14(2 - 15) - 2(2 - 27) + 1(-5 + 9)
Dx = 14(-13) - 2(-25) + 1(4)
Dx = -182 + 50 + 4
Dx = -128

For Dy, replace the second column with the constants (14, -1, 9):
| 3  14  1 |
| 4 -1  3 |
| 2  9 -2 |

Dy = 3((-1)(-2) - (3)(9)) - 14((4)(-2) - (3)(2)) + 1((4)(9) - (-1)(2))
Dy = 3(2 - 27) - 14(8 - 6) + 1(36 + 2)
Dy = 3(-25) - 14(2) + 1(38)
Dy = -75 - 28 + 38
Dy = -65

For Dz, replace the third column with the constants (14, -1, 9):
| 3  2  14 |
| 4 -1 -1  |
| 2  5  9  |

Dz = 3((-1)(9) - (-1)(5)) - 2((4)(9) - (-1)(-1)) + 14((4)(5) - (-1)(2))
Dz = 3(-9 + 5) - 2(36 - 1) + 14(20 + 2)
Dz = 3(-4) - 2(35) + 14(22)
Dz = -12 - 70 + 308
Dz = 226

Now we can find the values of x, y, and z using the determinants:

x = Dx / D = -128 / -21 = 128/21
y = Dy / D = -65 / -21 = 65/21
z = Dz / D = 226 / -21 = -226/21

So the solution to the system of linear equations is:

x = 128/21
y = 65/21
z = -226/21
